Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of CYP2C19 Metabolizer Phenotype and POAF Incidence after OPCABG

Participants.evidence: 320 patients undergoing elective first-time OPCABG from May 2017 to November 2023

Intervention.evidence: Patients were categorized into normal metabolizer (NM), intermediate metabolizer (IM), and poor metabolizer (PM) groups based on CYP2C19 genotyping.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of POAF within the first week post-surgery.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 320 patients undergoing elective first-time OPCABG from May 2017 to November 2023

Result_Outcome.evidence: POAF incidence was 20.9% in the NM group, 35.7% in the IM group (HR 1.843, 95% CI 1.155 to 2.940; P = 0.0076), and 57.8% in the PM group (HR 3.363, 95% CI 1.753 to 6.499; P < 0.0001).
